genes.title: é¡¹ç›®æ¦‚è¿°
genes.content: **Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)** is a sophisticated technique in Generative AI that enhances Large Language Models (LLMs) by dynamically retrieving and incorporating relevant context from external knowledge sources during the generation process. Unlike traditional LLMs that rely solely on pre-trained knowledge, RAG systems enable models to access up-to-date, domain-specific, or proprietary information, significantly improving accuracy, reducing hallucinations, and enabling real-time knowledge integration.

genes.title: ä½¿ç”¨æ–¹æ³•
genes.content:
- Complete basic [RAG implementation in Python](https://github.com/Danielskry/LangChain-Chroma-RAG-demo-2024): Full-stack RAG example with LangChain and Chroma
- [LangChain RAG Tutorial](https://python.langchain.com/docs/use_cases/question_answering/): Comprehensive guide to building RAG applications
- [LlamaIndex RAG Tutorial](https://docs.llamaindex.ai/en/stable/getting_started/starter_example/): Getting started with LlamaIndex for RAG
- [Haystack RAG Pipeline](https://docs.haystack.deepset.ai/docs/retrieval-augmented-generation): Building RAG pipelines with Haystack
